page.title: 07Trade Crosthwaite'area'
page.content: {Stud Farm:}One Austrian pure-bred{Arab stallion,named Mr.Beaujangles,after a negro folk-dancer.Each 'studding' costs Â£150.{English}mares. Horses bred and sold,sometimes abroad. {Cattle:}New breeds in area/country- {Salers}and{Blonde d'Aquitaines}-reared for leaner beef,the preference of the housewife in 1985. {Nurseries:}60acres where approximately 4000{Leylandii}trees are planted each year.Many die <major hazard is frost>, but many are sold,or sent to other nurseries. Started as a hobby in 1967. {Milk Round:}Crosthwaite Village,Lyth Valley & Winster - High Yews Farm. {Livery Stables:}caters for full,part and grass livery. {Damsons:}sold locally.Some crops sent to a jam factory in Newcastle. {Cottage Industries:}Hairdressing, Push-bells,Crafts.
